Name: Champs-Elysees Cocktail
Ingredients: 10 ml Green Chartreuse (or alternative herbal liqueur)
15 ml Sugar syrup 'rich' (2 sugar to 1 water, 65.0°Brix)
10 ml Chilled water omit if using wet ice
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Coupe glass .
Prepare garnish of lemon zest twist.
EXPRESS lemon zest twist over the cocktail and use as garnish.
Review: A great after-dinner drink for lovers of brandy and Chartreuse.
History: A riff on the Sidecar , The Champs-Élysées is named after the touristy Parisian avenue. The first known recipe for this cocktail appears in Nina Toye and Arthur H. Adair's 1925 Drinks-Long and Short .
Nutrition: One serving of Champs-Elysees Cocktail contains 188 calories
